name: SlySquid's Pawnshop
description: Lots of credits, lots of pressure and lots of stuff to PAWN...

name: Dispair & Loathing In NeoTokyo
description:
Untested deck.

Jinteki always advance.

Plan to build out a network of remote servers using exclusively upgradable assets and cash in using Diversified Portfolio and NeoTokyo Grid.

Ice is light, but hopefully RSVP comes up early and won't get broken too easily,

Always advance something every turn. Count on trick of light to move counters off failed traps.

Main win contition should be scoring out agendas, but a well-timed Ronin could end the game as well.

name: W32.Donut .NET
description:
Perfect opening hand?

  • Cache
  • Aesops
  • Daily Casts
  • Wyldside
  • Sure Gamble

Gets you rolling! If not, I'd mulligan for one of Aesop's, Wyldside or Cyberfeeders with some money.

Then just draw into early Grimoire, Donut and start denying money & milling R&D. Occasional runs are extraordinary effective, cause corp is usually left with porous defenses.

I was reluctant to put Djinn into the deck, but it turned out to be powerful - saves the day with 3 extra MU, and what is more, tutors you an Imp!

I don't even bother running archives, people usually shitting their pants seeing few agendas in there, icing up, and leaving R&D / HQ quite open, which you can penetrate fairly deep with occasional breakers suite and medium/nerve agent.

Besides having 3 Deja vu's and 3 Sure Gambles, Donut does not hurt you that much, cause Virus Pawnshop turns your rig into a cash cow.

And just one thing...

Cache is a game changing card.

This cell has been infected by dotNET virus!
.NET.dotNET by Benny/29A

name: Cheap Nasir
description:
The deck is your basic Ice destruction with cheap ways to make some cash like Lucky Find and Easy Mark. The Cyberfeeder's fit perfectly in to help save cash from Parasiting and using Atman.

Theirs no personnel workshop in this deck on purpose i found that with one in your deck you rely on getting it with the build and without it you struggle so i purposely wanted to build a deck that functions well without it.

I haven't got a console sadly lack of influence and funds means i can't justify one, when the astrolab comes out ill probably straight up trade a mem chip for it.

name: HQ Lock
description:
Get multiple access HQ runs going, use Imp/Demo Run to punish Scorch/FA decks.

Debating the usage of Breach/Passport here as you need to be able to pressure remotes so they can't just drop agendas into them without a care.

First draft. I have not tested this idea.

name: On The Origin Of Sterlings v 1.1
description:
V 1.1 - Took out the core crim breakers and the oracle combo, put in Crypsis and more econ and an indexing.

Now I know what you're thinking. No wait, you could be thinking one of several things like:

Why is your deck 49 cards? Why did you spend 6/10 influence on one of the worst breakers in the game? Why do you only have X copies of X?

Well the answer to those questions is I'm bad at deck theory. What I am good at, however, is playing Iain Sterling. I'm also bad at spelling his last name.

This deck hasn't lost yet. Now, granted, I've only played it 5 times on OCTGN, and 2 of those times my opponent didn't know I'd be playing a current, but hell - they count.

Most of this deck is classic Iain. Gather up your homies and then plan big game-winning plays with Legwork. Find Kati Jones and Mr. Li as fast as possible, set up your Access to Globalsec / Underworld Contact combo and your Oracle May / Motivation. Maybe most importantly get your Logos out as soon as possible. Use Fall Guy to keep New Angeles City Hall around so you don't get Sea Sourced since this deck doesn't run Plascretes.

The tricky part of this deck are the breakers. You want to get Darwin out a couple of turns before you think they're going to start making moves. Then you let him grow. You want to use the core breakers as last resorts - keep Femme and Darwin going for maximum efficiency. You're going to be getting 2-5 creds a turn anyway, so the hit on Darwin doesn't really hurt you in the long run. Also if they spend a turn wiping virus counters - GREAT! There's many more things that this deck would rather be doing than running, and the corp just gave you a free turn to do that. (This is a great time to play those core breakers and hit them with an unexpected siphon).

And remember, it's not the deck - it's the pilot. So you have to be as crazy as the deck to pilot it correctly.

name: che Kate v1.0
description: Based on the "Noise Sauce" deck, here is a Shaper alternative for using cache. I chose Kate for the -1 install cost. I have not tested this deck yet. Thoughts?

name: SlySquid's Pawnshop v1.1
description: Lots of pressure, credits and of stuff to PAWN... Plan to play a normal game and let the mills be an annoyance rather than a focus.

name: AoA: Reina's Icecapades II
description:
This is my Anatomy of Anarchy (great read, found here: http://teamcovenant.com/botounami/2014/05/20/anatomy-of-anarchy/) deck, mixing it with my first Reina deck.

The problem most people run into when building a deck is going overboard with a theme and then not having a usable deck at the end. You see this with people putting tons of random programs into Professor decks or putting Scrubber into Whizzard decks. I originally went pretty far with Reina's ability, adding Xanadus and all the Rooks along with Forged Activation Orders to really screw with the corp. This would generally work, but my running game was slowed and not as good as it could be because of it.

I used the AoA template here to give myself a good foundation to build off of, still using Rooks (but not Xanadus) to go with Reina's ability.

My problems as of now are wondering if I really can use Wyldside. It works with Noise because he can always be slapping down viruses, but Reina can't necessarily play two cards each turn. That along with the fixed breakers, which I haven't really used too much, are what I'm mostly testing in this deck to see if they should be changed out. Y0g could probably go now that Lotus Field has come into existence.

name: Noise's Virtual Date
description:
I was considering under utilized cards yesterday, and had an idea for using Woman in the Red Dress in a Noise HQ deck.

At the start of the Runner's turn the top card of R&D is revealed.

If it's an Agenda or card the Corp wants they would draw it. The Runner now hits HQ with Nerve Agent to score the Agenda or trash the card with an Imp token. Otherwise they leave it on R&D and you have the option to mill it.

Neat!

name: SlySquid`s Replicating Tentacles v1.1
description:
Ahoy hoy, SlySquid here hot off my day and the Canadian Nationals...

so if your looking for a great decushion on the inner workings of this deck please read the OP, because the only changes are 1 less Medical Research Fundraiser, 1 less Shiro and i added 2 Lotus Field i wasnt going to run any at all but i saw so many AndySucker decks it was gross...

So I`m helping to build a better world by trying to hose that deck in what ever little way i can (;,;)

It was Suggested to me by @kirkzor, thanks man!

name: Duggar's Sympathy
DickButt
Replicating Pain
description:
Felt like posting this up after U.S. Nationals. Went 10-2, only losing to two Parasite spam recursion dex that LARLA'd.

The main reason I'm posting is to show how playing against popular perception can work well. Most RP dex I see have little to no teeth to them. As a result, Runners can get reckless when facing them, not wanting a long game. I decided to use that to my advantage with this build, which in turn led to 5 flatlines in 12 competitive games. I think that's pretty strong for a deck that isn't dedicated to murder.

I'll spare you any card choice breakdown; we all know how these dex work. Put punishing ICE on Centrals, and ETR/Elis on assets and remotes. Use Jacksons liberally. Don't be aggressive. Enjoy.

name: The Dutchess
description:
Highway to the DANGERZONE

So this deck has been doing me amazingly well on OCTGN lately. The basic idea is that they HAVE to have both an answer for the barriers and the sentries in order to beat the glacier playstyle of the deck. Not only that but inazuma in front of a destroyer punishes them for having forgotten their decoder. Since there's no other code gates though, they aren't given a reason to install a decoder until they've found the inazuma at which point it may be too late.

Prior to The Spaces Between, I was running 3 corporate trouble shooter and the executive retreat were split into more 2 pointers. Worked decently that way but have changed it since to have slightly lower agenda density. The most important additions have been will o the wisp and login encryption protocol. I feel such a strong current out of HB is almost like cheating with such easy access to archived memory to replay your current if it does actually ever get trashed and then also such punishing bioroid ice guaranteed to have some subroutine be unclickable even if they run as first action. #Will o the Wisp on your servers with barriers will also give you a strong play to make certain that even if they got through, they'll have to do an awful lot of recovery work to rebuild their rig. Most games I find that you're able to wreck their rig beyond repair by just focusing on killing Fracters and Killers.

name: Stronger Together
Chaotic Neutral
description: Get efficient ice breakers fast, run often, deep R&D Dig as alternate win plan if corp is too scared to make remotes.

name: Live Free or Die Hard
description: Work in progress...targeted, precise runs. Crypsis as a "break everything", chess pieces to make its job easier and help with targeted strikes, parasite to get rid of annoying ice, everything else is support.

name: King Trick
description: Possible decklist for a Jinteki deck...I think the pilot is going to heavily influence how good this is.

name: King Trick - NBN
Wrath
description: Probably needs better trashing ice, but am really short on influence... Elizabeth Mills has yet to be drawn in the first few games and the deck seems to play fine without her.

name: That's No Moon - Scorched NEH
description:
2-2 at Game Night event. A few bad slots (didn't ever use Bad Times or Freelancer. Never had a chance to rez Archer.) I feel those spots could be used more efficiently. Deck is uber poor.

Maybe one or two PAD campaigns would help.

name: Keyhole Whizzard
description:
2-2 at Game Night event. Deck is bad. Disregard.

I liked Lucky Find and Legwork. The special orders should probably have been more legwork. The icebreakers weren't good (Knight was fine, as was Crypsis), the deck is most effective when it can play breaker-free.

name: Grifter Red Dress Ken 1.1
description:
Centers around early game aggression. The idea is to get as much out of a run as possible while maintaining HQ pressure.

Desperado, Security Testing, Grifter, Lamprey, and Masanori are all strong together. Pair this with run events and Kens ability and you can apply some heavy pressure. Dirty laundry is sick.

Woman in the red dress is crucial when an agenda is on top. It puts the corp in a hard spot to leave it there and be grabbed off r&d or take chances against sneakdoor + hq interfaces. Also has demo run to keep hq small for max agenda.

name: Gabe Robbing (1st @ Canadian Nationals Side Event)
description:
My runner deck at the standard constructed event going on beside the Canadian Nationals. Piloted this deck to a record of 7 wins 1 loss.

Net Celebrity was added in as a way to kick corp currents and the free dollar is always a bonus on the first run.

Only thing I'm looking at changing is finding a place for a dedicated sentry breaker. The 3 Faeries and 2 Knights did enough but it was getting quite close some games.

Three Steps Ahead quickly shined as well especially with Desperado out and if the corp is creating a ton of servers like Near Earth Hub. It's like getting 1 turn with Gabe's ability on every server!

More tweaking to be done to the deck but so far it is looking quite good.

name: Ivory Tower of ICE (1st @ Canadian Nationals Side Event)
description:
My crop deck at the standard constructed event going on beside the Canadian Nationals. Piloted this deck to a record of 7 wins 1 loss.

Not too much changed from the usual fast advance style HB deck I like to run but I did find room in the deck for a couple of Targeted Marketing. Still feeling out what is the best cards to name but it can work great as a stall tactic or force the runner into a corner if you name key cards such as breakers, parasites, siphon accounts, etc.

I decided on only running Eve Campaigns for asset economy as I found that I liked seeing a draw of Blue Level Clearance over the Adonis campaigns I use to have in the deck.

name: Crash & Trash No-Parasite Nasir
description: This is still very much a work in progress, and I'd love feedback, especially since I'm sort of going against the grain meta-wise on this one (no parasite? GTFO?). Self-modifying Code is down to 2 because Nasir so badly wants his programs on the Personal Workshop, but sometimes you just have to tutor out that Magnum Opus or Nerve Agent. I've also changed Diesel to Quality Time and added Public Sympathy to dampen the negatives of its mass draw as well as to act as a de facto Plascrete. Kati Jones is out: I found myself much more willing to click Mopus for an immediate 2c than clicking Kati for a future 3. Net Celebrity is gone because it was more meant to combat the hypothetical presence of a corp current, but that's not my style - I'd much rather play my own game. Demolition Run can be used to wreak havoc once you have a clear shot into a server, and you can Same Old Thing it for an added punch (best practice is to avoid getting a SOT on the table before Demo Run if possible, just to delay any tip of your hand); mix it with multi-access for extra fun. Parasite is gone entirely, though I'm not sure whether this is a mistake. So far though, I'm able to justify dropping it because a) it's 4 inf. and b) so many times I'd find myself either without the means to tutor it up, or without the willingness to play it; it was mostly a "blast through a surprise Pop-Up" card, and I feel that careful rig building with Ghost Runner and Cache makes those surprise low-costs much less of a problem. Clone Chip is still in to recur Cache, though it can also be Scavenged in a pinch.

name: Mushin-Mallow
description: Nothing like a toasty and scorchin' marshmallow :)

name: Overmind Meidan
